description: To address the issue related to CVE-2023-36425, it is essential to apply several updates available for different Windows versions. For Windows 10 and Windows 11 systems, ensure to install the updates listed in the corresponding KB Articles: KB5032199, KB5032192, KB5032190, and KB5032189. The update packages can be accessed through the following links: [KB5032197](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032197), [KB5032192](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032192), [KB5032199](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032199), [KB5032254](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032254), [KB5032249](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032249), [KB5032196](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032196), [KB5032252](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032252), [KB5032198](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032198), [KB5032247](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032247), [KB5032190](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032190), and [KB5032202](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5032202). The updates support various build numbers for both x64-based and 32-bit systems, ensuring comprehensive coverage across different installations. Conduct maintenance by following installation procedures and verifying version specifics to ensure compliance with the patch requirements.
